practice_one.question: What outcome and significance did War of 1812 with USA have for Canada?
options: Canada became part of the USA
Canada kept it’s independence from the USA
Canada lost a lot of land in the war
practice_one.answer: Canada kept it’s independence from the USA

practice_one.question: British Columbia is known as Canada’s Pacific Gateway Because?
options: It is on the Pacific coast
Immigrants arrive from the Pacific Ocean
Goods are shipped to and from the Asia
Fishing industry relies on the Pacific Ocean
practice_one.answer: Goods are shipped to and from the Asia

practice_one.question: Who is governing Canada at the federal level on a daily basis?
After the  ‘Quebec Act of 1774’ was passed, which of the following is true?
options: Act allowed to worship catholic religion
Act allowed Quebec to be independent
Act added French as official language
Act let people to live legally in Quebec
practice_one.answer: Act allowed to worship catholic religion

practice_one.question: Which is NOT true about Canada’s relationship with USA?
options: Canada exports very little to USA
5 Great Lakes lies Between Ontario & USA
practice_one.answer: Canada exports very little to USA

practice_one.question: Which four provinces first formed Confederation?
What is the meaning of national motto ‘A Mari Usque Ad Mare’ in Latin?
Fatima is a new immigrant to Canada, and she can choose to take a job like any man because?
options: Equality of women & men in Canada
practice_one.answer: Equality of women & men in Canada

practice_one.question: Which religion does the great majority of Canadians belong to?
What role do the police in Canada play?
options: They maintain the traffic in city

practice_one.question: Whom do you vote for in a federal elections?
How do you vote in a federal elections?
What is NOT a responsibility of a Canadian Citizen?
options: Learning to speak both official languages
practice_one.answer: Learning to speak both official languages

practice_one.question: What is one of the requirements to vote in federal election?
options: Must be on a voter’s list
At least 16 years old on voting day
Must be living in Canada for past 3 years
practice_one.answer: Must be on a voter’s list

practice_two.question: What are three branches of government?
options: The Queen, House of Commons & Senate
The Queen or King, Parliament & Courts

practice_two.question: What is the significance of the Canadian discovery of insulin?
options: It saved lives of people with diabetes
It helped the treatment of heart diseases
It saved lives of children with sickness
It saved soldier’s life during WWII
practice_two.answer: It saved lives of people with diabetes

practice_two.question: Why is it important that everyone is innocent until proven guilty?
options: Only judge can presume a person to be guilty
Everyone is entitled to due process under the law
The police takes time to investigate the case
practice_two.answer: Everyone is entitled to due process under the law

practice_two.question: Which three oceans surround Canada?
options: Arctic, North Atlantic and Indian Oceans

practice_two.question: On the general Election Day, who do you vote for?
options: Member of Parliament in your constituency
practice_two.answer: Member of Parliament in your constituency

practice_two.question: Why trading with other nations is important to Canada?
options: To make the Canadian forces more powerful
To maintain our standard of living
To increase the productivity of Canada
practice_two.answer: To maintain our standard of living

practice_two.question: What province is the largest producer of hydroelectricity, pulp and paper?
What region is called the ‘Land of the Midnight Sun’?
What is the principle that our legal system is based on?
options: New immigrants are exempted from laws
The laws do not apply to judges & the police
Everyone is equal before the laws
practice_two.answer: Everyone is equal before the laws

practice_two.question: What country is Canada’s largest trading partner?
What are some of the sources of Canadian citizen’s rights and responsibilities?
options: Our history, laws, traditions, identity & values
practice_two.answer: Our history, laws, traditions, identity & values

practice_two.question: What is a Voter Information Card?
options: A form that tells you where & when to vote
Let’s you know the voting schedule
Tells about candidates in your electoral district
practice_two.answer: A form that tells you where & when to vote

practice_three.question: What are the responsibilities of municipal government?
Why the Battle of Vimy Ridge is important in Canadian history?
options: It has symbolize Canada’s becoming as a nation
It was an important victory in the Boer War
It  was the last battle of the First World War
Out of it was formed the Canadian Corps
practice_three.answer: It has symbolize Canada’s becoming as a nation

practice_three.question: What does NAFTA provide?
options: Free trade between any country & Canada
Free trade between Canada, USA & Mexico
practice_three.answer: Free trade between Canada, USA & Mexico

practice_three.question: What is the meaning of ‘presumption of innocence’ in our judicial system?
options: Everyone is innocent until proven guilty
Everyone is guilty until proven innocent
The judges are assumed to be innocent
Some are innocent while some are guilty
practice_three.answer: Everyone is innocent until proven guilty

practice_three.question: What should you do If you do not receive a voter information card before election?
options: Tell the Member of Parliament in your riding
Give up your right to vote

practice_three.question: Does the law apply to police, judges, and politicians?
options: It depends on the nature of the crime
No person or group is above the law
The police are above the law
practice_three.answer: No person or group is above the law

practice_three.question: About one third of all Canadians live in which province?
How many Canadians have died in wars till now?
What are the two official Languages?
How are Members of Parliament chosen?
Which two fundamental freedoms are protected by the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms?
options: Aboriginal people’s rights and mobility rights
Equal employment rights and job opportunities
Basic living rights and obeying the laws
Freedom of belief and freedom of religion
practice_three.answer: Freedom of belief and freedom of religion

practice_three.question: How many provinces are there in Canada?
Which city is the capital of Canada?

options: Members appointed by the Prime Minister
Members choose by the Queen or King

practice_four.question: Which of the following matters are responsibilities of provinces?
Which civilization is the biggest part of the Canadian population?
List two freedoms that Canadians enjoy?
options: Freedom of religion & freedom of love
Freedom of association & freedom of living
Freedom of thought & freedom of religion
Freedom of peaceful & freedom of travel
practice_four.answer: Freedom of thought & freedom of religion

practice_four.question: Which province is the most easterly point in Canada?
How can you vote in an election if you are going out of the country?
options: Vote at the advance polls or by special ballot
You can give your right to vote
Vote when you are in a foreign country
practice_four.answer: No person or group is above the law

practice_four.question: What province is largest producer of oil and gas?
Why did Canada Declare war on Germany in World War II?
options: To defeat Adolf Hitler’s Nazi tyranny
To fight Communism in the world
practice_four.answer: To defeat Adolf Hitler’s Nazi tyranny

practice_four.question: A Member of Parliament from Montreal decided to spend the weekend in her electoral district. This means she will be?
options: Taking a tour in the province of Quebec
In part of Montreal where she was elected
In Ottawa to prepare for an election
In Quebec city to visit her friends
practice_four.answer: In part of Montreal where she was elected

practice_four.question: Who was the first Prime Minister of Canada?
Who were the founding people of Canada?
Who are partners in the NAFTA agreement?
How do you mark a ballot?
options: A circle over the name of a candidate
Write your name and home address
An ‘X’ beside the name of a candidate
practice_four.answer: An ‘X’ beside the name of a candidate

practice_four.question: The significance of Canada Day is because it is?
options: The day Canada defeated the USA in a war
The day Canada passed the new constitution
practice_four.answer: To celebrate Canada as self-governing Dominion
